citation.article-title: Pseudomonas flavescens sp. nov., isolated from walnut blight cankers.

p.s: Description of Pseudomonas flavescens sp. nov.
Pseudomonas flavescens (fla.ves'cens. L.v. flavesco, to become golden yellow; L. part. adj. flavescens, becoming golden yellow)
Both strains that have been isolated are aerobic, gram negative, and oxidase positive.
The cells are slightly curved rods (0.6 to 0.7 by 1.6 to 2.3 μm) and are motile by means of a single polar flagellum (Fig. 1).
They are negative for arginine dihydrolase activity, ice nucleation, and hypersensitivity.
They do not denitrify, nor do they accumulate poly-β-hydroxybutyrate.
Hydrolysis of gelatin, starch, and Tween 80 is negative, and growth does not occur at 37°C.
Colonies are yellow on YDCP medium and King medium B, and a diffusible fluorescent pigment is produced on King medium B.
β-Glucosidase, rutin glycosidase, and pectinolytic enzymes are not produced.
These organisms do not cause soft rot of potatoes and do not produce levan.

The following compounds are utilized for growth: acetate, cis-aconitate, D-alanine, L-alanine, α-aminobutyrate, L-arabinose, L-asparagine, L-aspartate, betaine, 2,3-butanediol, caprate, caproate (slowly), caprylate, choline, citrate, citrulline, creatine, ethanolamine, fumarate, galactose, galacturonate, gluconate, glucose, glutamate, glycerate (slowly), glycerol, glycolate, heptanoate, L-histidine, p-hydroxybenzoate, β-hydroxybutyrate, β-hydroxymethylglutarate, itaconate, α-ketoglutarate, L-lactate, L-leucine, D-malate, L-malate, malonate, mannitol, mannose, mesaconate, mucate, pelargonate, proline, pyruvate, quinate, saccharate, serine (slowly), succinate, sucrose, m-tartrate, trehalose, trigonelline, and xylose.

The substances not utilized for growth include acetamide, transaconitate, adipate, adonitol, p-alanine, α-aminobutyrate, α-aminovalerate, δ-aminovalerate, α-amylamine, anthranilate, D-arabinose, L-arabitol, L-arginine, D-aspartate, azelate, benzolate, benzoylformate, benzylamine, butanol, butylamine, butyrate, cellobiose, citraconate, n-dodecane, dulcitol, erythritol, ethanol, ethylene glycol, D-fucose, geraniol, glycine, n-hexadecane, hippurate, histamine, homoserine, m-hydroxybenzoate, o-hydroxybenzoate, inositol, insulin, isobutanol, isobutyrate, isoleucine, isovalerate, 2-ketogluconate, kynurenate, kynurenine, lactose, levdinate, L-lysine, maltose, D-mandelate, L-mandelate, melibiose, naphthalene, nicotinate, norleucine, pantothenate, phenol, phenylacetate, phenylalanine, phthalate, pimelate, n-propanol, propionate, propylene glycol, ornithine, L-rhamnose, ribose, rutin, salicin, sebacate, sorbitol, sorbose, spermine, starch, suberate, D-(-)-tartrate, L-(+)-tartrate, testosterone, L-threonine, D-tryptophan, L-tryptophan, L-tyrosine, and L-valine.
The base composition of the DNA is 63 mol% G+C.
